title: Rina Sawayama Sends ‘Big Love’ to Sabrina Carpenter, But Calls Out Cultural Insensitivity in ‘SNL’ Performance
summary: She also asked creative teams to employ more "research, respect and care" when referencing cultures.
body: Rina Sawayama has nothing against Sabrina Carpenter , but parts of the latter’s Saturday Night Live performance of “Nobody’s Son” over the weekend didn’t sit right with the former. Related Sabrina Carpenter Drops F-Bomb, Dances in Underwear While Performing ‘Manchild’ & ‘Nobody’s Son’ on ‘SNL’: Watch Domingo Returns to ‘SNL’ as Sabrina Carpenter Parodies Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’: Watch Sabrina Carpenter’s Debut as ‘SNL’ Host: All 8 Sketches Ranked On Instagram Stories on Sunday (Oct. 19), the Japanese-British singer-songwriter shared a clip of Carpenter’s showcase, which had a martial arts theme. As the hitmaker sang while wearing a short white robe and black belt as a dress, background dancers acted out a fight sequence behind her. Zooming in on the footwear of the background performers, Sawayama wrote, “Big love to Sabrina but fellow artists creative teams … if we are clearly referencing a culture, please can you do so with the research, respect and care it deserves.” “Shoes on tatami is jail,” she added. …

title: Eric Wareheim Gets Existential About the Steakhouse
summary: Steak House pays homage to the country’s many steakhouses and the staff who have shaped them | Photos by Marcus Nilsson/Ten Speed Press | Collage by Masood Shah Eric Wareheim, the media and food-world multihyphenate, has been to a lot of steakhouses — at least 65, in fact, while conducting research…
